page.title: 01Ben Rinnes and Glen Farclas
page.content: This block contains the west shoulder of Benrinnes and several-now unoccupied - hill parmo. The parmos are mainly used for cattle grazing and there is rough pasture in the main with only some fields in cereal crops. The main feature is Glenfoudas Distillary-producer of a world famous malt whiskey "unblended and unsurpassed". The distrillery employs 20 people and produces 3/4 milliion gallos annually and was founded in 1836. One modern feature is the visitors centre where tourists are shown around the distillery - able to sample the product visit a video- exhibition centre and and craft shop. Visitors last year 60,000 - came from all over the world and some 14 guides are employed in summer season. There is another distillery employing about 4 people.
